title.narrative: EMERGENCY COORDINATION

description.narrative: By the end of 2019, all Ministries in charge of Humanitarian Action and Civil Protection including their central and decentralized structures have adequate and appropriate resources and skills for improved coordination, preparedness, and response to conflict, epidemics and natural disasters., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation And Research, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: [Programme Effectiveness] : Country programmes are efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2019, all Ministries in charge of Humanitarian Action and Civil Protection including their central and decentralizedstructures have adequate and appropriate resources and skills for improved coordination, preparedness, and response to conflict,epidemics and natural disasters.

description.narrative: Focusing more and more on the link between humanitarian and development, risk-informed and adaptive programming, UNICEF considerably improved the overall level of emergency preparedness and response at both national and regional levels, especially through pre-positioning of relief stocks, partners capacity building and enhanced coordination of national and regional actors. During 2019, 133,026 people (among whom 74,494 children) received non-food humanitarian assistance following floods and internal population displacements caused by insecurity, exceeding the target of 50,000 people. In addition, contingency stocks were successfully pre-positioned and maintained in the concerned regions. | Status:Met | As-of Date:07/02/2020
